main event: Four diamond-shaped objects were seen flying in a northwesterly direction over Ferndale, Michigan on April 15, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were described as being in the shape of a diamond and were about twice the size of the largest star.
The objects were a deep red color.
The objects were flying at a very high altitude, with speed comparable to a falling star.
No aircraft were found to be airborne in the area at the time of the sighting.
A full inquiry was made with available agencies, but no conclusive explanation was found.
